intro: Rinorea malembaensis, commonly known as the Malanda tree, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often lobed and have a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
